stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

stadium.name: The Aegis Field
stadium.description: A pristine field within the main temple compound, used as the central training ground for the Shield. The pitch is bordered by the library and monastery, and is said to be protected by the twin lights, Dawn's Hope and Silver Twilight.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Re-taping their shield's handle with fresh leather.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Drinking a full waterskin of lukewarm water.
Drawing a detailed, anatomically incorrect diagram of a troll's head.
Passing a 'team luckstone' from player to player without speaking.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Challenging a spectator to a game of tic-tac-toe in the dirt.

preGame:
GOOD EVENING, TROLLBALL FANS! üéôÔ∏è This is Nok the Corrupter, broadcasting LIVE from the dizzying heights of The Glowstone Terrace in the World's Spine Mountains! üèîÔ∏è Can you smell that? No, it's not the brimstone of my home sweet home, it's the smell of COMMERCE and VIOLENCE! Tonight, we have a match that pits the insufferable piety of The Haven Lights against the chaotic capitalism of The Confluence Captains! üí∞

Let me tell you, folks, I took a look at the visitors' locker room, and it makes me sick! ü§¢ The Haven Lights are over there engaged in some truly bafflin' behavior. Their Healer, Riffle Harrington, is actually tying his bootlaces together and hopping around! Is that a strategy? Or just the typical incompetence we expect from the Temple of Light? And don't get me started on Tybi Reo, who is drawing an anatomically incorrect troll head on a chalkboard. It looks more like a potato with teeth! ü•î These do-gooders are protected by "Dawn's Hope," but let's see if hope can stop a raw egg-fueled tackle!

Speaking of fuel, the home team is READY TO RUMBLE! üç≥ Ladew Evelina of the Captains is chugging raw eggs‚Äîshells and all! Now THAT is protein! That is grit! And O'Conner Maighdlin has been speaking in rhymes for the last hour. Is it a curse? Is it annoying? Absolutely! But it's the kind of chaotic energy we love here in Confluence! The Guild of the Black Sky is watching, folks! Chairman Ironrock and that beautiful, plague-loving Brennen Farno are surely expecting a return on their investment! Get your drinks ready, because tonight, we dine on violence! üç∫üë∫
postGame:
Well, folks, the dust has settled, the blood has been mopped off the Glowstone, and I am disgusted to report the final score! ü§Æ The Haven Lights have somehow, miraculously, defeated The Confluence Captains with a score of 2 to 0! A travesty! A miscarriage of justice! But oh, the VIOLENCE was sweet, sweet candy for the soul! üç¨

The game started with a BANG! üí• Ladew Evelina, fueled by those raw eggs, absolutely DEMOLISHED Coward Tarton early in the first half! CRUNCH! Tarton went down faster than Nikos Thanae's approval rating! That's how you start a game of Trollball, folks! Pure, unadulterated aggression from the Captains!

But then, tragedy struck. The goody-two-shoes Shiroma Salim managed to get a hold of the ball. Instead of fighting like a demon, he took the coward's way out and SHOT the ball from the Home 2-Point zone! üèÄ And of course, it went in. 2 points for Haven. I nearly threw my microphone off the terrace! Disgraceful precision!

Retaliation was swift, but messy! Coward Tarton, miraculously recovered, decided to take out their anger on O'Conner Maighdlin. BAM! The rhyming stopped immediately as Maighdlin was flattened! ü§ï I haven't seen a bard silenced that effectively since Cyfnerth the Butcher reviewed a poetry slam!

But the Captains weren't done! Ladew Evelina, the MVP of my heart tonight, hunted down the scorer Shiroma Salim and SMASHED him into the pavement! üöë Another injury! Another beautiful crack of bone! That is the spirit of Confluence! Who needs points when you can collect medical bills?

The Haven Lights, despite their shiny armor, fought dirty tonight, folks. Berkin Waters caught Vonni Geoff unaware and sent him to the infirmary! And then Tybi Reo‚Äîthe one who can't draw‚Äîdrew a line of pain right across Caves Cestar's face! ü©∏ The injuries were piling up faster than paperwork on Chairman Toland's desk!

We went into Halftime with bodies strewn everywhere! üöë A quick break for the Healers to work their underpaid magic, and we were back in the fray! The second half was a defensive slog, a beautiful gridlock of pain!

O'Conner Maighdlin came back with a vengeance! He tackled Marlane Lounge so hard I think Lounge forgot how to play tic-tac-toe! ‚ùå‚≠ï KO'd! Sent to the benches! That is the Confluence way! You might beat us on the scoreboard, but you'll leave in a wheelchair!

And let's not forget Stephan Lisk! He saw Dickenson Beker trying to be useful and said "NO THANK YOU!" BOOM! üí• Another Haven player bites the dust! The Captains were handing out naps like they were free samples at the market!

Despite the brutal beatdown handed out by the Captains, the scoreboard remained frozen. üßä The Haven Lights take the win, 2-0. They may have won the game, but they certainly lost the physical battle! Go home and polish your shields, you light-loving nuisances! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! REMEMBER: If you can't win, make sure the other team can't walk! üòàüëã
